headline: US Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Futures Slip as Rate Cut Bets Rise Amid Weak Jobs Data
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Tuesday, Nov, 25 2025 US stock futures are slipping this morning, with S&P 500 contracts down around 0.1 percent. The key factor driving the mood is a drop in the 10-year Treasury yield to 4.04 percent, its lowest in a month, after central bank officials suggested lower rates might be coming soon because the US job market is losing steam. This means borrowing money could get cheaper, but it also hints that economic growth is not as strong as...
